About

I'm a freelance data scientist and engineer focussing on building robust data and machine learning pipelines. Since 2017 I've worked with various blue chip companies across major industries such as telco, e-Commerce, pharma.

I'm also an open source enthusiast and the maintainer of sklearn-contrib: category encoders a Python library for encoding categorical features in order to use them in machine learning models.

Data Science

Coming from a background in mathematics, I do have strong theoretical foundations in statistics, data analysis, optimization and machine learning. I help my clients building machine learning models with their data using libraries such as xgboost, scikit-learn or spark-ml.

Projects:

  • Fraud Detection model based on realtime click-stream data @otto.de
  • Recommendation System @adidas
  • Supervised learning models for a variety of use-cases on time-series data @telefonica

Data Engineering

A machine learning model will only generate value if it runs in production. This is why I do not stop with the modelling, but focus on delivering robust, well-tested data pipelines following state-of-the-art software engineering practices.

Projects:

  • Time-series analysis framework leveraging PySpark @telefonica
  • ETL Pipelines ingesting SAP data into S3 using NiFi @SICK AG

Automation

I believe there is a lot of value in automating and digitalizing business processes - with or without machine learning. I connect smart machines and robots by building interfaces - command line as well as graphical - to automate data transfers making the business ready for industry 4.0.

Projects:

  • Automation of biochemical analytics by building interfaces within an automated laboratory system @Roche
  • Built a web-based application for ingesting data into an ELN system @Roche
